alert.note: Alert for Eastern Albany; Western Rensselaer (New York) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Albany (Eastern New York and Western New England)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued September 08 at 7:17PM EDT by NWS Albany
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of southeastern Albany and southwestern Rensselaer Counties through 745 PM EDT... At 717 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm over Feura Bush, or near Delmar, moving east at 25 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph, nickel size hail, and heavy rain. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Heavy rains could cause flooding. Locations impacted include... Albany, Troy, East Greenbush, Rensselaer, Nassau, Delmar, Menands, Ravena, Voorheesville, Castleton-On-Hudson, West Sand Lake, Wyantskill, Feura Bush, Selkirk, Wynantskill, Averill Park, North Greenbush, New Scotland, Poestenkill and South Troy. This includes the following highways... Interstate 90 between exits 10 and 5. Interstate 87 between exits 21A and 23. Interstate 787 between exits 1 and 7. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.88 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch remains in effect until 1100 PM EDT for east central New York.
